intro: Psorospermum victoranum, commonly known as the Victorian psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many shrubs in its family. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
